intro: Ctenitis pleiosoros, commonly known as the broad-leaf rock fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its large, leathery, serrated fronds that can grow up to 1 meter in length. It typically grows on rocky outcrops or in shaded, moist environments. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
